content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This week in Genesis we’re exploring two new themes, discovering lots of theme discounts, and unearthing some top class tutorials.

—

Themes

Some great themes (and theme deals) this week. First up, StudioPress release Gallery Pro, a gorgeous new theme by Bloom Blog Shop.

Gallery Pro Theme was designed by @kelseygrauke w/ both clean presentation & e-commerce success in mind #genesiswphttps://t.co/FiHjHKOLXV

— StudioPress (@studiopress) October 5, 2016

Next up, Keeper, a new minimal Genesis theme, with WooCommerce support, from Ryan Townley over at Minimal Genesis.

Meet Keeper, a flexible minimalist #genesiswp theme with deep style integration for WooCommerce. https://t.co/oTbWxBGTB9 pic.twitter.com/6eOrp7ZAxa

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) October 3, 2016

Also you might want to grab Ryan’s lifetime, all themes deal which closes today (prices goes up 10 October).

Save over 50% with the Lifetime All Themes Package for a limited time. Price goes up Oct 10th! https://t.co/qEPkApPgQQ #genesiswp

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) October 6, 2016

ZigZagPress is currently offering 40% off all their themes and theme packages with code 3YEARS. (I’m not sure when this one expires, but it works at the time of writing).

Help us celebrate! Get 40% off every #genesiswp theme and theme package with code 3YEARShttps://t.co/NWfQ4cbYvj pic.twitter.com/y1dPpScEj5

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) October 6, 2016

And appfinite’s brought back(?) their ‘buy one, get one free’ deal on themes (use code BOGO on checkout).

Now is an excellent time to grab 2 #WordPress Themes for the price of 1! https://t.co/Ql5uekhqOZ#genesiswp #webdesign pic.twitter.com/RVVAQsbrzo

— appfinite (@appfinite) October 3, 2016

Calvin Koepke (who’s published many free Genesis themes) has started coding his new one.

Finally starting the coding process of my new #genesiswp theme, and going to explore doing things differently.

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) October 7, 2016

Showcase

All new (and super slick) redesign by Lindsey Riel for her website prettydarncute.com (h/t Susan Ramsey)

Two words #confettifail (or is that one word?) – Love the revamped https://t.co/IGiQTIrt1u #GenesisWP #blogging @lindseyriel #GenesisWP

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) October 7, 2016

Great new design by PIXL Designs for leadthecause.org (h/t StudioPress).

It's a fun week when a partner's #genesiswp site launches! Check out the new Lead THE Cause site https://t.co/nbDyza6mpV from @dare2share pic.twitter.com/lbR5L6phZX

— PIXL Designs (@pixldesigns) October 6, 2016

Bourn Creative with a new site for sandjmandarins.com (featuring a nice Gravity Forms shipping integration).

New #genesiswp site for my parent's mandarin farm with a slick Gravity Forms shipping integration https://t.co/KBacbAyrHQ

— Brian Bourn (@brianbourn) October 4, 2016

Justin McGuire for fcoc-cenex.com

Proud to announce another website launch from Vivid Image https://t.co/hlw9JCANhJ #GenesisWP #TeamVividImage pic.twitter.com/CFYE5HbKPi

— Justin McGuire (@jemcgui) October 6, 2016

And, Tonya Mork has updated her WP Developers Club website – on Genesis, course – at wpdevelopersclub.com

And @thewpdc is running on #WordPress, #GenesisWP, @SiteGround, and @wpninjas. We used @DesktopServer to build it. https://t.co/Q5RfkWlFKV

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) October 6, 2016

Podcasts

Good new podcast episode from StudioPress.fm on entrepreneurual mental health with Cory Miller of iThemes.

New SP FM episode: The Importance of Entrepreneurial Mental Health with @corymiller303 — https://t.co/MtnAwtPssA

— StudioPress (@studiopress) October 5, 2016

Best of the rest

Great article from Carrie Dils on Genesis Child Theme Development: How to Make it Yours (h/t StudioPress).

New from the blog: Genesis Child Theme Development: How to Make it Yours https://t.co/liZuLi4dfK

— carrie dils (@cdils) October 4, 2016

Nice (free) tutorial from Sridhar Katakam on doing a split navigation (logo in middle, with menu on left and right) in Genesis.

Split Navigation with menu items on logo's left and right in Genesis:https://t.co/QVRnUVKXGMhttps://t.co/RenUTJzWTe#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/jmTOSIlB8X

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 8, 2016

…plus, another (free) tutorial that’ll be useful to a few of your I’m sure, how to relocate titles in Genesis Featured Posts widgets’ output.

How to relocate titles in Genesis Featured Posts widgets' output:https://t.co/lJEs796uRE#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/Dkk9ncO7M0

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 6, 2016

League WP reviews 30(!) Genesis plugins.

28 Best Genesis Framework Plugins Reviewed: The Ultimate List https://t.co/ATKHsFvKme #genesiswp

— League WP (@league_wp) October 3, 2016

brandiD is looking for a part time Genesis developer (h/t Sridhar).

The brandiD is looking for a part-time #GenesisWP WordPress Web Developer.https://t.co/NQbUBWnUsW

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) October 4, 2016

Jesse Petersen’s working on a new mobile-first plugin.

I’ll be the tease… our revolutionary #genesiswp mobile-first plugin is really looking nice now. Screenshots when close to launch.

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) October 4, 2016

—

That’s all for this time, have a great week and – if you don’t already – please subscribe below, I really appreciate it.

excerpt.rendered: We explore two new themes, discover lots of theme discounts, and unearth some top class tutorials.
